Reviews.Title: “central but secluded”
Reviews.Author: alan_mtl
Reviews.Content: excellent location down a quiet lane between Accademia & San Marco, with modern rooms of a decent size, with some canal views. Breakfast buffet was above average, and staff were very friendly & helpful. Vaporetto: Giglio or Accademia. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: natasha v
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel is a real luxury resort, it deserves 5 stars! The location is fantastic: you are close to the center (2 minutes walk) and at the same time the hotel is situated in a quiet street. We arrived at night ant the hotel reminded me a medieval castle! The rooms are perfect (we stayed at the second floor), the bathroom is awesome! Everything was clean and up-to-date. I'm very critical but even I enjoyed it! I saw some pics here showing several drawbacks of furniture and bathroom, but that's not about the room where we stayed! It was cool! Can't say anything about meals, because everytime missed the breakfast time. We found a nice cafe at the nearby square where they cook a tasty pizza and pasta. Wanna go back! And surely recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: CatalinRoca
Reviews.Content: Beautiful luxury hotel in Venice, well located. The rooms are nice, a lot of TV channels from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and central!”
Reviews.Author: Cherrypashka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Dei Dragomanni for 2 nights during Carnival and were quite pleasantly surprised by the price and quality. My room looked luxury and new, it was nice and comfortable (even if it were a single room). The only thing I can comment on is that the shower itself was really small, but I am petit, so this is not a problem. The other thing is that I were expecting something more for warm food during the breakfats except boiled eggs, if we are talking about 4-star hotel. The rest was perfect - very central location - 3 minutes from Accademia bridge and 10 min maximum from San Marco. Stylish rooms, very helpful staff, free WI-FI, great breakfast serving, etc. So I can definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “High cost average room”
Reviews.Author: optplyr
Reviews.Content: All the hotels near Saint Marks square are expensive to begin with,($450 US a night plus) this one is no exception. The rooms are typically small but are very nice and some have views. Its located right on the canal but if you are taking a vaporetto...or ferry, its a few blocks over 4 bridges that is difficult to get to with luggage. its easier to take a water taxi that will drop you off right at the hotel. I've never been a fan of the hotels in Venice because they are typically smaller than most other hotel rooms in Italy and this one fits right in. With that said the rooms are comfortable and very clean. The bathrooms are updated and new with enough room to maneuver around. The hotel is a little hard to find and most of the people you might ask are no help. Remember the street you are on so it may be a little easier when you get back from dinner and drinks. If you are taking a cruise I suggest taking a water taxi, and if you are alone or a couple, you might want to try to share the ride as they are expensive ($100 US). try to talk them down if you can...mine did it for $80. Not bad between 4 people but if there is 1 or 2 of you, again try to share the cab ride. I would stay here again but I would also try another hotel just to see the differences.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: xinco
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, rooms nice, perfect location very near to all the attractions you want to visit in Venice. Everything is in walking distance, centrally located but far enough not to be noisy. When we go back to Venice since our visit in Nov 2010 to we'll definitely would stay at the Dei Dragomanni.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Patti2357
Reviews.Content: This hotel was provided everything we were looking for. It is in a quiet area and very quaint. Traveling with two adult children, we were given a room with a very large terrace overlooking the Grand Canal. The four of us could gather here at the beginning and end of each day, enjoying view and gondola activity. At night it was breathtaking. The bathroom was beautiful, heated floors, soaker tub, all marble and the bed was the most comfortable of all the places we stayed in on our trip. The service was good. The staff spoke English and were very helpful. The location was about a 10 - 15 minute walk to St. Mark's and many other attractions. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel let itself down”
Reviews.Author: SVRF
Reviews.Content: Okay we know Venice is very touristy and accommodation tight. In that regard the Hotel Dragomanni was a great hotel. Close to transport and all the best attractions but far enough away not to be noisy. We were given to 2 rooms for our family of 4. Heaven! But the service was aloof, and generally unhelpful. It was simply an unfriendly place to stay. We simply didn't feel wanted.

Reviews.Title: “3 is a bit harsh”
Reviews.Author: Londontownie_11
Reviews.Content: 3 is a bit harsh, but I'm not sure that the hotel is 'very good'/4 stars. My girlfirend and I stayed in one of the rooms with a view of the grand canal (across a couple of rooftops). The room was more or less opposite the Peggy Guggenheim museum which was nice. To clear up some confusion in earlier reviews: - The Dragommani is not ON the canal, it is set a few buildings back - If you want a with a good view of the Grand Canal ensure that it is on the 3rd floor. Contrary to earlier reviews, I think this is quite clear on the website. The room was small but well formed, with plenty of storage and a good bathroom. The breakfast is good if a little uninspiring. The hotel is superbly located in a quiet enclave between St. Marks and the Accademia bridge. All in all I would recommend you stay here, it is a good hotel. Possibly not quite as luxurious as the website would have you believe, but a decent and not bank-busting place to stay in the centre of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Tonmig
Reviews.Content: Canâ€™t ask for better service, quality and comfort. The location is ideal for pedestrian touring. The folks there are pleasant and courteous.. Highly recommended..

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Snail107
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with the Hotel De Dragomanni. We had a vision of a romantic hotel in Venice, with a view of the Grand Canal. We were wrong. We booked the hotel because of its proximity to the major sites and because the website states that it has views of the Grand Canal. We expected the hotel rooms to have a view of the Grand Canal. It appeared that only a few rooms on the top floor may have had views of the Canal. Our room certainly did not have a view of the Canal. Rather, we our room had a window off to the side of the room that overlooked the street and wall of the next building. The hotel is not right on the canal, but a few buildings behind it. I understand that as with most hotels, not every room has the perfect view. We requested Grand Canal view on our reservation. When we checked in and noticed that we were on the first floor (which could not possibly have had the view given the location), we mentioned that we had requested the view and asked if we could move to a room with a view. The front desk employee completely dismissed our question and stated that he could see our request on the reservation. He then proceeded to hand us our keys and told us that another employee would show us to our room. We asked if another room was available. We were simply told no. I felt like they made no effort to accommodate us. If it wasn't late at night, and I hadn't been up for 24 hours, I would have protested. At this point, I was ready for a bed, view or not. I feel like their website is completely misleading. Wifi is a charge 5 Euros per hour. You will only receive free wifi if you book online through the hotel website, which is a current special. The hotel was located in convenient spot. It was short walk to the Academia and St. Mark's, as well as many restaurants and shops. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go in Venice. It was also very quiet. I am a light sleeper, and I could not hear anything from the street or in the hallway. The reservations also included a continental breakfast. We walked through a bar area if we used the stairs to get to our room, but I never actually saw anyone use it. There's also a small courtyard area located off of the bar. Our stay at the hotel was fine, but I never could get over my disappointment with the view or how the front desk staff handled it. That was my one request for my stay in Venice--a view of the Grand Canal--and I was completely mislead by the website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katrin1410
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days at this hotel and had a small, but beautiful, romantic, charming room with view on the Canale Grande et the Peggy Guggenheim Museum. The room was quiet and also had a tiny balcony. The breakfast room is very small and therefore the breakfast buffet not very big, but they do make the best out of it. The buffet is filled up constantly and the cappuccino is delicious. Besides that, the staff is very kind and helpful. Although not everything was perfect (e.g. the minibar was not always filled up, there was few space for the clothes), we recommend this hotel without any hesitation and would ourselves go there again. Last but not least, the geographical situation is great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect staff, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: sfabiani
Reviews.Content: Staff was perfect, give Us a late Check out, indications, concierge, etc. The location is Very near of boat Station ans 500 MTS of st marcus square.

Reviews.Title: “Snooty service, dusty hotel - a rip off. Bad experience.”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller1219
Reviews.Content: We were at the end of our Italian vacation. After traveling to Milan, Rome, and Florence, I must say that this is the worst hotel room we had. I know hotels in Venice are not cheap, but we paid EU350, the refrigerator was not working, front desk staff were snooty and when we asked for a recommendation for dinner, they sent us to a restaurant that we had already tried to get reservations at, but was full. I tried to tell them the restaurant was full, but the front desk guy looked at me like I was crazy and said "no reservations needed." The refrigerator was not working and when we opened it up to get a drink out it smelled. After telling the front desk, they acted like it was no big deal - no apology nothing. We enjoyed the rest of our Italian vacation, but unfortunately the last night in Venice at the Hotel Dei Dragomanni left a bitter taste in our mouths. Needless to say we will not be going back again. Not recommended to other travelers

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SGJH
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful with a great view of the Grand Canal and the Peggy Guggenheim gallery. The room was very quiet as it just far enough away from St. Mark's Square. The staff are extremely friend and very fluent in English. They kept our bags for a few hours after checking out so that we could enjoy our day. They also served a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rich46503
Reviews.Content: Off the beaten track, but very near to water taxi stop which is the way to get there from the parking garages. Rooms are good quality, service is excellent and efficient, we even had glasses of wine delivered to our room for small charge. Hotel is near a couple of squares which have highly rated outdoor restaurants. Would go to Dragomanni again next time we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for a family with a great location”
Reviews.Author: AKR1
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here a few weeks ago and the hotel exceeded our expectations. Finding a hotel room for 4 without a pullout couch serving as a bed in Venice is hard. Dragomanni delivered with a great large room, and a perfect bathroom with a large ceiling window that could be opened. For us a good hotel bathroom is critical. Very nice, professional staff, adequate breakfast and a perfect location. We took a water taxi from the airport which delivers you 50 feet from the hotel door on a flat alley. Its a worthwhile cost as it gives you a great introduction to Venice. Our room did not have a canal view but that was explained upfront. The room had a strong wifi signal at very reasonable rates. The Accademia vaparetto stop is about a 7 minute walk, while just across from the hotel's pier on the Grand canal you have to wind you way to the Accademia bridge. In summary, strongly recommended, and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Beautiful and Clean Boutique Hotel and would return in a hearbeat!!”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBellaAmericana
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect in so many ways and exceeded our expectations. It was located just a short walk from San Marco, but nestled in between numerous restaurants and shops. It was nice to be a few streets away from the main crowds to rest and sleep in the cozy bed at night. The staff was wonderful and helpful. A staff member waited outside for us in to lead us to the hotel at night. It was decorated tastefully and the rooms were cool and very comfortable. The breakfast that was included was delicious, the cappucino and salami and fresh rolls were to die for after a hard night of grappa, spaghetti and gelato. We would definitely stay here again. It was a great price compared to other big names, but had the perfect "Italian" feel and charm we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: brissotravellers
Reviews.Content: This is down a small street (which is often dirty with rubbish/litter) and doesn't look much from the outside...don't be fooled. The rooms are modern, clean and large. Service is perfect. The location is really handy for everything and away from the tourist hourdes. Friends stayed at another place right on a canal and spent the night listenihg to the noise of gondola tours going passing their room. Our room was the exact opposite. Quiet and peaceful. Great front desk staff who couldn't have been better. Good breakfast included. The price is not outrageous for Venice and we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rhanna1
Reviews.Content: Location very good, close to everything Room clean and renovated, we had a double room for four with two bathrooms. Staff is very nice and helpfull, they speak english, french and of course italian. Breakfast is good and generous Overall great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel close to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: akirtania
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family in late June for 3 nights and it was undoubtedly the best of all the hotels we stayed in our 2-week Italy-France trip. We stayed in Suite #26 which is in the attic. It had a separate seating area with sofa and a computer desk. The bedroom had a king bed and two other beds for the kids and all the beds were very very comfortable. The bathroom was very modern and all the rooms had sunlight. What a treat in a very expensive city like Venice! Best of all was the Air-conditioning. In every other hotel in Italy, I found the airconditioning was not sufficient. But not so in Hotel Dragomanni. Every night we came back to this cool room after a sweaty long day. The housekeeping left the thermostat setting to 18C everyday. What a fantastic difference from other hotels where the Airconditioning shuts off as soon as you leave the room. Access to the hotel from the train station is easy. We took the waterbus to the Giglio station and followed their direction. The hotel is situated in a typical Venetian narrow alley and it had no sign whatsoever. All of a sudden you see the HD logo of the hotel and the tastefully decorated lobby. It is only a 5-10 minutes walk to Piazza San Marco, the heart of Venice. The only negative for the hotel is their exorbitant pricing on Wi-fi something like Euro 5/ hr. Since I had signed up for international Data roaming before leaving U.S. I decided to not use hotel's wi-fi. However, the hotel staff was kind enough to print our boarding passes for our flight to Paris. The Breakfast buffet was pretty good and the staff was very courteous too. All in all, we all had a great experience in this hotel and in Venice and I would go back to this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good position nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silver999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The hotel is in a good position in a nice quiet area. It is beautifully decorated. Both our room & bathroom were large although there was no air-conditioning which at times made the room stuffy. There was no view; the window overlooked the building next door. The bed was very comfortable & there was good water pressure & plenty of hot water. The mini bar/fridge didnâ€™t work. We asked for it to be fixed on the day we arrived but it was not fixed during our stay. Continental breakfast is fine â€“bread rolls with ham cheeses fruit etc

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for location”
Reviews.Author: FashionD
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, however, it didn't impress me beyond what you'd expect in a place to stay. We stayed in a classic room, and it was just your basic hotel room. It's comfortable and feels clean, but lacked any charm, which is fine - just stating my opinion. No complimentary Internet was a bummer. Also, the room we stayed in would only allow us to take a 5-min shower before the water would overflow out of the shower area (clogged drain) - to be fair, we didn't inform of this until we left, which I'm sure they would've had repaired or gave us a new room if they had known. We just didn't want to deal with it while only staying for 2 days. I will say it's in a great location (3 min walk to St. Mark's Square and food). The staff is very helpful and friendly. That was the highlight. They have a complimentary breakfast with cold items, which was a nice perk.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel w/ Modern and clean Interior”
Reviews.Author: sugarplumshoes
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night but the hotel exceeded our expectation. it looks very unassuming from the outside but is well decorated and modern inside. the only thing that didnt work was the Air Conditioner but by opening the windows we got cool breezes at night. internet is 15euros for 6hours and breakfast came w/ the booking. just like any hotel in venice, it requires hauling your luggage across bridges so we packed very light to make the walk enjoyable from the vaparetto stop to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor but service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: Yanaka
Reviews.Content: Air conditioner is turned off in April. We were on the third floor so it got warm and stuffy. We opened the windows at night to get some ventilation which resulted in letting Mosquitos in the room. We were both bitten multiple times. The service I experienced was fine but I watch the person at the front desk argue with a client. This was the reason I rated the score for service low.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Somewhat Misleading”
Reviews.Author: SightsAndSoul
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Dragomanni in October 2010, with a small group of women. The hotel's main attribute is it's location, near the Grand Canal, off Campo Santo Stefano, but hidden on a charismatic side street. Despite the claims on its website it is NOT ON the Grand Canal. You can see the Grand Canal from one of the top floor rooms, but it is a superior room and costs extra. People in my group had nice rooms, but mine was a handicapped room, and rather akward for someone who doesn't need it, especially the bathroom. The breakfast was really nice, especially for Italy where it is usually minimal. We had some going back and forth with the management regarding the final price of the rooms which ended up costing more than the original price. The front desk staff was pleasant, and the maids were doing a good job. I am not going to bring my clients there again this fall because I didn't like the way my guests were treated, but if you don't mind that, the hotel itself is fine.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER-AVOID AT ALL COST!!! SERIOUSLY”
Reviews.Author: KonstantinR
Reviews.Content: I posted my extensive review about this property 3 weeks ago but it was for some reason deleted. Don't want to spend any more time writing how bad this property really is! I wouldn't stay there even if they paid me to. Awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: Floridacruiser1
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff is verry friendly and helpful. A member of the hotel staff met us at the water taxi to help with our luggage. The room was clean and comfortable with a high ceiling. The bathroom was modern. The hotel is close to St. Marks. The wi fi in the room was quick and reasonably priced. The pictures on the hotel's website are accurate. The hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Traveldogs36
Reviews.Content: This small but appealing hotel experienced some serious issues that affected our enjoyment of this hotel while we were there. It is impossible to say if these are ongoing or an anomaly during our stay. The most critical was the lack of hot water. Every day (4 day visit) we experienced this in one way or another, either having just lukewarm water or no hot water at all. The staff advised us this problem affected the whole hotel and they were working on it but it was not resolved when we left. The other problem the extremely cool room temperature in the common areas. This certainly detracted from our breakfast experience. Our mini fridge did not work and the hotel was unable to remedy this during our whole stay. On the plus side it is very accessible by water taxi, the representation of the rooms on the website is accurate and the staff were very helpful with great restaurant recommendations, sightseeing information and general friendliness. The breakfast options were plentiful with fresh fruit and made to order coffee. It is very walkable to some great restaurants, San Marco Piazza and shopping. If not for the hot water issue we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we chose Hotel Dei Dragomanni!”
Reviews.Author: AdvofJoshNCheryl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were told to get off at the wrong stop from the water bus and had to travel with 2 big suitcases over bridges and through crowds...but it was all worth it when we arrived at Hotel Dei Dragomanni. The hotel is located on a quiet street, but close enough to Venice attractions. The staff there were so kind, and even upgraded us to the penthouse suite at no additional cost. The views from this room are beautiful and romantic. We slept very well there and awoke to a very good breakfast downstairs. It we ever return to Venice, we will be staying here! Thank you Hotel Dei Dragomanni! Wests from Houston

Reviews.Title: “That was a wonderful and sweet experience in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: meisongyh
Reviews.Content: a lovely hotel, elagant room,and kindly staffs. Thank you for the grade up service for us.Let us spend a romantic night in venice.A sweet memory!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: kmoll
Reviews.Content: This attractive hotel is conveniently placed between Piazza San Marco and Accademia, right opposite Peggy Guggenheim collection. Our room was beautiful and comfortable with a view of a garden (a rarity in Venice!) and the Canal Grande, just. The breakfast was fantastically good with gorgeous fresh fruit, cereals, meats and cheeses, something for everyone. Staff were all extremely helpful and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable and easy to reach via public ferry”
Reviews.Author: MLJ2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by an Australian friend who had stayed 6 months previously. Whilst it is not directly located on a canal, it is a lovely little hotel and has a good feel about it. The hotel is nicely presented; the staff are friendly; the breakfast was very nice available in a quaint little breakfast room and we all remember how lovely & hardworking the young girl working there was! The rooms clean and a good size. No complaints from our group of 8 whatsoever. Venice is all about exploring so once you check-in, get a map and go for it!!

Reviews.Title: “close to the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Dei Dagomanni one night before we left for our cruise from the Venice harbour. The hotel has a great location, you can reach the main attractions within 10 Minutes. We booked a family room which had two extra rooms with a door. Sadly the room was not very clean, we found dust everywhere and some other pollution in the bath room. The breakfast was nice but there were no vegatables beside tomatos. I think it is overprized for the quality here but all in all hotels in Venice with such a location are expensive. I would probably stay again although there are some concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: pugalram
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new and the room was excellent. We took the room with a balcony which had a view of the Grand Canal. It was great sitting on the balcony and sipping wine wathcing the boats go by. It is in a perfect location, between St.Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. The braekfast (included) was good.. There is no room service for food, but there are restaurants and pizza places near by. The water taxi drop off/pick-up location is just a few yards from the hotel entrance. I recommend the taxi over the water bus, although it is more expensive. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but very inconsiderate staff :(”
Reviews.Author: ma02
Reviews.Content: We had asked for a double delux room which typically we were told occupies 3 and you can have a cot for the 4th person. We arrived much later than our expected time. The man at the front desk was very rude in registering us when he realized we were 4 people. He just kept repeating- cant help, room was prepared for 2, cant provide you with extra blankets, staff in morning will take care of your situation! Morning staff was better but we still ended taking 2 rooms and therefore paying double of what we had planned. Breakfast is good but there is NO VARIATION from one day to the other.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE BUT BE AWARE OF WHAT YOU'RE BOOKING”
Reviews.Author: ChampagneShelley
Reviews.Content: High quality rooms and bathroom and an excellent location if youâ€™d like to be close to the action but away from the noise. The hotel is located down a quiet, cute street leading to a small jetty - very romantic. (This jetty is where youâ€˜d get off if you were taking a private water taxi to the hotel, however this is not necessary if youâ€˜d like to save 50 euro. The hotel provides details.). WARNING: I quoted the room name (Classic Double) which appears on www.bookings.com however the photograph of this room does NOT match the room name. The Classic Double DOES NOT have a small balcony overlooking the grand canal, as advertised. They were not willing to move on this point when we questioned the room we were given. Also, the WiFi signal was extremely poor from all public areas and our room. I was unable to connect for 2 daysâ€¦they refunded the cost of the usage.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: 155032Sandra
Reviews.Content: The location was ideal; the breakfast was delicious; the room was beautiful; the staff was attentive....all in all a great hotel to stay at for a trip in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful place! Truly Venice, spectacular view of canal, and incredibly comfortable room in every way.”
Reviews.Author: scazcowgirl
Reviews.Content: We loved the feel that his was an old palace of nobles that has been both preserved and updated to be a very comfortable hotel. the staff were very friendly, helpful, available, and guided us to some great experiences including a private gondola tour of the canals with a guide who did a phenomenal job and was sweet and funny as well. the staff were even available in the middle of the night when we arrived and were helpful and kind when we were so exhausted. one awareness i would offer; from the looks of the map on mapquest, one would think it would be easy to find; NOTHING is easy to find in Venice. i know i read that in others' reviews and i blew it off; don't! our flight was delayed and re-routed so we arrived in Venice at 4;30 in the morning and there is no one around to ask directions and it was terribly confusing. print yourself directions before you go, print a map blown up so you can see all of the tiny streets before you go; you'll be glad you did; i wish i had!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Roberto0053
Reviews.Content: The Dragomanni is just the right distance from the concentrated activity on San Marco, on a quiet side street in a remodeled palace. The staff is courteous and helpful, and speaks English well. The breakfast is superior -- good coffee and tea, meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, cold cereal, breads and pastries, fruits, yogurt, orange juice, etc -- compared to what you get in most hotels anywhere in the world and compared to the light fare typical of Italian breakfasts. Rooms are impeccable, clean, quiet and attractive, and the beds are comfortable. Unlike most hotels that advertise Wi-Fi Internet service Dragomanni's actually works and as a bonus the speed is excellent -- which overcomes the extra cost (15 euros per 6 hours of usage, purchased at the desk, smaller increments available) and the inconvenience of remembering to log in and out each time you use it. We plan to return to this hotel on our next visit to Venice. Highly and enthusiastically recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming”
Reviews.Author: NZRae
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely place to stay at and we would not hesitate in recommending it. Very accessible to get to if you take a water taxi. Five minutes walk to St Marks Square. The room we had was charming, the staff very friendly and helpful. They have high standards for their guests and stopped us from taking our luggage down to the water taxi ourselves as this was part of their service.

Reviews.Title: “Once we switched rooms, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelers804
Reviews.Content: After the room switch it was world's better! Bottom line - don't accept room #3 unless they have fixed the problem below. Highlights first: Room #4 was excellent. The rooms have high ceilings making them feel very spacious. My husband was most excited about ESPN in English that was offered here. Our mattress was very comfortable and we slept well. We had a great breakfast buffet each morning. There were a variety of meats, cheeses, fruit, pastries, cereal, and juices. The location is excellent. It is centrally located to so many different areas of Venice, yet down a quite alley. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, especially with the room change. We arrived to the Hotel Dei Dragomanni late at night and are assuming they put us in the last room available. The lobby staff walked us up to our room showing us the bedroom. It wasn't until he left and we opened the bathroom door that we were disgusted. The room was excellent, but there was a reason the bathroom door was closed. The sewer smell in the bathroom was unbearable! We had to breath through our mouths and didn't even feel comfortable leaving our bathroom products in the bathroom. We were so tired we just closed the door and went to sleep. The next morning we talked to the hotel staff and they were very accommodating. They promised to move our bags across the hall and give us a new room for the next night. If we had been given room #4 from the beginning, this hotel would have been rated excellent. We felt they handle this problem/request very well. We would return to this hotel on future visits to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish and quiet find”
Reviews.Author: English-Rosa
Reviews.Content: Initially tricky to find (but isn't everything in Venice?) we were delighted to step out of the hot July sun into this peaceful, stylish and very air-conditioned hotel. As a group of four friends weâ€™d booked the family room in the attic which was spotlessly clean, cool and quiet with a lovely bathroom. Although with four adults there wasnâ€™t a lot of room it had the bonus of a separate lounge/office area and worked out at very good value for us for a nights sleep before our cruise departure. Very well located for a water taxi but would have been a hike with suitcases for the water-bus. We were very happy to stay here â€“ a small hotel but very nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, very clean and friendly - a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Stantonys
Reviews.Content: Visited Hotel Dragomanni following reading the reviews - and can only agree with the content of those who praised this hotel! Very convenient location - (Nearest no 1 vaperetto stops are Giglio or Accademia- approx 5 min walk!) Very clean & Air conditioning worked well, (Luckily as it was so hot!) Lots of restaurants/ coffee shops / ice cream shops etc nearby (although beware - the centre of town tends to close down at approx 11pm). Remember to buy a ACTV pass (available for 12 hrs/ 24 hrs or 36 hours) which enables free travel on all the main ACTV ferries - and also the no:5 bus - which takes you to / from the main Venice airport (Marco polo) - in about 30 minutes..Would def. visit again - thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: cuddly
Reviews.Content: Very impressed about this hotel. Location says it all. On a side street 10 metres from a water taxi landing pier on the Grand Canal, this hotel is all peace and quiet, though it is a mere 5 minutes walk to San Marco or the Accademia. I stayed in a top floor canal view room with a spacious balcony overlooking the Grand Canal -- best view one can get after a long day's sightseeing in Venice. This is a small boutique hotel, with modern decor, room and bathroom both functional and aesthetic. Staff polite and helpful, and we experienced great service from the porter who assisted us with our water taxi transfer.

Reviews.Title: “although the rooms were relatively roomy...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: although the rooms were relatively roomy the hotel certainly wasn't 4 star standard. The 3 stars in Switzerland were MUCH better. However the owner and staff were very helpful and efficient. We made a reservation for 3 nights but due to a flight disruption we stayed only 1 night. They were extremely considerate by charging us only for the night we spent there. Bathroom was medium size but could have been better. No shower curtain so entire bathroom got wet when you showered. Breakfast had the usual vareties. Lotd of fruits, yogurts, cheeses, cereals and breads. This was despite the fact that we went down ten mins before breakfast closing time! Overall would rate as three star.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: co1234
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. The only down side is that the hotel is several blocks from the water bus so I would only recommend this hotel if you or comfortable walking ~10 blocks with your luggage. I suppose you could get a private water taxi to and from the hotel but it is expensive (I think we were quoted 100 euro each way).

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel where the rooms look exactly like to photos on the website. This is my seconf trip to venice and this hotel made the stay memorable. The rooms were clean and stylish. The TV worked well. The bathroom was spacious and the shower had good water pressure. The only issue was that you had to climb into the shower via the bath which was quite high so for short people this could be tricky. The hotel was in a nice quiet location but very close to good resteraunts and major tourist attractions. The breakfast was lovley and had good choice. The bar was also great place to unwind after dinners. The staff were helpful and non intrusive. I would recommend this hotel and I would definatley stay here again. Really lovley.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room, best sleep of the trip!”
Reviews.Author: Caropa
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The evening staff was incredibly helpful, and gave great dinner recommendations. The room was beautiful, clean, large and so comfortable. And great breakfast! The hotel was not right on the canal though... its very close, but the building it is in seems to be being renovated at the front portion that is on the water. Otherwise, good location, lots of lovely streets to walk around on. It was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the great view over the Canal Grande”
Reviews.Author: pigroHK
Reviews.Content: We are most impressed by the nice view. Our room has an excellent view over the Canal Grande although the hotel is not located directly next to the Canal. We enjoyed the busy canal during the day and the Collezione Peggy Guggenheim under flood light, just at the other side of the Canal, makes the night view appealing too. Besides the view, the room is beautifully decorated and comfortable. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The location is good. It is only 5 minutes walk from water bus stop with two small bridges only. If you have been to Venezia, you would know how terrible it would be to carry baggage crossing bridges after bridges. It is in a quiet street with bright light in the night, not the typical dark back streets in Venezia. It is also close to Piazza San Marco. The price, though not cheap, is good for the standard of Venezia and good for value.

Reviews.Title: “The classic standard room is anything but standard!”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueeny
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a lovely 3 days in Venice. It was our first trip and hopefully won't be our last. Next time we will definitely go when the weather is warmer. I can imagine the city is 100 times more beautiful if the sun is shining. We flew with Ryanair into Venice Trevisso airport. We took the ATVO bus to Venice (45 mins) â‚¬9 return. Then from P. Roma we took the ATVO ferry Line 1. to the Giglio stop as advised on the hotels website. (35mins) which takes you all the way along the Grand Canal. â‚¬6.50 return. General advice whilst in Venice is : Everything is very expensive. I paid â‚¬10.50 for a cappuccino in one restaurant, so search for non touristy restaurants to eat in. If there is live music there is an additional charge on your bill. In San Marcos square I paid â‚¬11 just to listen to an Orchestra while I drank a cup of coffee. Check your bill! Several places double charged certain items. It is very easy to get lost so buy a good map or bring a compass. You instantly lose you bearings because the alley ways are so windey. Don't get roped into conversations with people on the street. They will want money at the end. Ok so, onto the review of the hotel... Reception, Breakfast Room and general areas were clean, well decorated and faultless. They weren't 5 star stunning, but they didn't need to be. They were functional. The room on the other hand was absolutely gorgeous. Cosy, beautiful, wooden beams, high ceiling, four poster bed, two windows where we had views to the grand canal, lovely traditional venecian artwork on the walls, not remotely shabby, spotlessly clean and my god what a comfortable bed. Lovely bath with rain shower overhead. Small but cosy bathroom and bedroom but extremely luxurious. You MUST push the boat out and pay the extra â‚¬50 for rose petals in the room. We arrived to a room full. Petals everywhere you looked. A heart design on the bed. LOVE written in petals in the bath, petals in the sink, petals on the bedside tables, petals on the writing desk.... it was the most beautiful thing I have ever seen. I also pre-ordered a bottle of Prosecco and plates of Cold meats and cheese. I wouldn't bother with the food but the Prosecco was lovely and refreshing. I will list the few negatives but only because I need to be objective. None of these things bothered me particularly because the amazing room made up for it. Ok, so... we arrived to a very hot room. Heating was on full blast. We tried switching it off but never did seem to get any cooler. We slept with the windows open which was actually rather nice. The hair dryer didn't work, I called reception and they immediately brought us up another. Day 2. The maids cleaned the room, took our old towels and forgot to give us new ones. I called Reception and more were instantly brought up. Day 3. We hung the Do not Disturb sign on the door but they came in and cleaned anyway. Breakfast consisted of Cereals, Yoghurts, Cold Meats, Cheese, Hard Boiled Eggs, Apricot Croissants, Sponge Cake, Whole Fruits, Shortbread biscuits. Cappuccino was lovely. There are only 6 tables in the dining room which is not enough for the 25 bedrooms. So that's my review. Beautiful Room. I do not begrudge the â‚¬480 I paid for those 3 nights in room 19 (3rd floor) Classic Room.

Reviews.Title: “I strongly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donegalabu
Reviews.Content: This is a 4* hotel in the centre of Venice, just 10 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco. It is in a quiet location, the staff are friendly and courteous, and although it was quite expensive to stay there, I would strongly recommend it for its location, comfort and cleanliness. The room was very nice with a lovely spacious bathroom. We had to leave early on the last morning and the night porter checked us out. He had difficulty in working the credit card machine and ultimately I had to give him a debit card as he kept saying the credit card was being refused. When I phoned Visa when I got home, they had no record of his attempts to put through the charge which demonstrated that he couldn't use the machine correctly. Therefore, I would recommend getting one of the receptionists to take your payment instead of waiting for the night porter. The breakfast was lovely and by Italian standards it was substantial. There was plenty of choice and variety with very helpful staff. To find the hotel, get off the boat at San Marco square and turn left, walk around to the left of the tourism office, take an immediate right, then left. Head for Campo Maurizio. Calle del dose ponte is in the top left hand corner of the square. The hotel is about 3/4 way down this street on the left. Top tip - when in Venice, go to see Musico a la palazzo. They run operas at very affordable prices. Tickets can be purchased at the tourism office in Piazzo San Marco. Fantastic experience and I would strongly recommend making it part of your trip. All in all, a great hotel in a great location in a fabulous city

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: martingiles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and although the room was alittle small compared to others we had on our trip, it was well appointed,clean,quiet and comfortable. Breakfast was more than adequate and the location was within walking distance of the Venice hilites. The staff was very helpful during our stay in arranging an alternate pickup plan to go to the airport. To those of you who have never been to Venice, the only way to get around is by foot or water bus/taxi. I had read this many times prior to our trip and thought I was prepared, but to get to most hotels you must cross the canal bridges which have STEPS not flat/curved surfaces. Try hauling all your luggage up & down these bridges for awhile. Needless to say I did this only once-on the way in from a vaporetto landing. The arrangements I had made to get to the airport would have involved a similar excursion because it was a collective pickup from one of several central locations. The hotel manager took it upon himself to call our transit company and arrange for them to pick us up at the hotel landing to alleviate this problem and I am forever in his debt. It made the rest of our stay as enjoyable as it should be for a once in a lifetime vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A nice discovery in Venezia!”
Reviews.Author: French
Reviews.Content: Willing to spend a few days in Venice with husband, mother-in-law and a niece, I tried to find a good hotel, conveniently located, and I think we did! This is a nicely refurbished palazzo, quite close to Canale Grande, and easily reachable, would it be by vaporetto or private taxi. Rooms are not very big, but nicely decorated and quiet. Internet service worked well. Breakfast was more than adequate. The only thing you could say is that the breakfast room is sometimes too small, even if the hotel only has 25 rooms or so. Service was excellent, the team is always eager to give you information, book restaurants, etc... The only tiny thing would be regarding room cleaning, since the lady always forgot to re-supply us with soap or bath products. We will be back! P.S. And we will never forget our surprise to discover Paolo, head of reception, seating one rank behind us at the long-awaited Simple Minds concert on Piazza San Marco!!! But nobody remained seated very long!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,Excellent location A little gem”
Reviews.Author: peter grafton
Reviews.Content: Family break with wife,daughter and her husband and stayed four nights booked in March, two de luxe rooms at 220 euros per room per night.Excellent value for Venice.This lovely hotel is in the centre of the Grand Canal between Accademia and Giglio "vaporetto " stops.The front door is less than 100 metres from the Grand Canal!and if you travel from Marco Polo Airport by private water taxi(95/100 euros !) it will deposit you almost outside.If travelling from St Marks Square follow the signs for Accademia,pass over three bridges and enter Campo S.Maurizio, the hotel is down a little side street over on your left going towards the canal. This hotel is a little gem.Our rooms were large with lovely bathrooms,spotlessly clean and the staff who spoke excellent English were very helpful.Breakfast is Continental style,cereals,bread rolls cheese and ham,fruit etc. If you are staying for two or three days avoid St Marks Square between 10am and 4pm as there are hordes of day trippers and the place is teeming with people.It is a lot quieter late afternoon and in the evening it is magical. Similarly if you want a gondola trip it is 80 euros during the day but is far more romantic if you go early evening although the cost is 100euros.Both trips last forty minutes. Best value is a Vaporetto ticket which will take you around the Grand Canal and you can visit The Lido which has a beach and also visit Murano,Burano and Torcello all on the same ticket !A three day pass cost 33 euros amazing value! I know Matteo and the staff at the Hotel read these reviews and I will just say thank you for a lovely stay and we hope to see you again.Peter and Jill Grafton.Katie and David Burke

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: curious2092
Reviews.Content: Our family of four - married couple with two kids - age 10 and 13 - loved this hotel! Matteo was an amazing host, the hotel was beautiful, well-kept and delightful; the breakfast was scrumptous; and, the location was outstanding! Can not recommend this hotel highly enough. Only problem was the wi-fi was expensive and unreliable - but that is true across Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, Matteo, from us in Florida!”
Reviews.Author: DawnTodd
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Europe for our 20th anniversary was unbelievable! The experience included a wonderful stay in this beautiful Hotel Dei Dragomanni in Venice. I searched for weeks looking at websites for many hotels and found this gem. Matteo responded quickly to all my questions and he personally made sure we got a gorgeous room with a view of the canal. It was perfect. Clean, well appointed and very quiet, our room was superb. The staff was also always accomodating, friendly and helpful whether we were late to breakfast or needed to find a shop selling phone calling cards! The architecture and decor was impressive and breakfast delicious. Thank you to everyone who made our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Family”
Reviews.Author: Jon143
Reviews.Content: After being shocked by the prices quoted for four people at other hotels, I was pleasantly surprised to find the Hotel Dei Dragomanni, quoted as a four star hotel, available for the price of two people at most of the other places I looked at. What a delightful surprise. Pros: Extremely friendly and helpful staff; convenient location (walking distance to Piazza San Marco); adequate breakfast; excellent air conditioning (necessary as the August temperatures in Venice were around 100); spacious room for 4 Cons: Water was working only intermittently on our departure morning while they were fixing a pump; while it's walking distance to everything, the immediate neighborhood is, um, sleepy. Things to note: - If you're arriving by vaporetto with a lot of bags, you'll have to cross a bridge or two from the nearest stops. We came by (pricy) water taxi, which drops you at the end of the block from the hotel. - Be sure you know exactly where the hotel is. There's no sign visible from the street so it would be easy to miss. Once you know where it is, though, it's easy to find again. - Everyone was very helpful and David in particular was willing to invest all the time required to help us sort out dining recommendations, walking plans, etc. - We had the family suite on the top floor. The main bedroom was large and comfortably slept four in the three beds. The sitting area is small and awkwardly shaped but was adequate for us to set up all our suitcases. The bathroom was great and very large by European standards. - Internet is pricy at 5 Euros/hour. Note, however, that it's per hour of usage, not an hour of clock time once you sign on, so that you can get a real hour of usage, however many minutes at a time that you need. - It was great to walk back into a cool, even cold, room after coming in from the hundred degree Venetian heat. For that alone, the room price was a bargain. - While pricing other hotels, I found they were charging from 200-250 Euros per night PER PERSON. Getting this room at about 350-400 Euros per night for all four of us made it a great bargain. Even without the price savings, I would consider this a perfectly pleasant hotel. When you factor in the value component, I would say it's a fabulous choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: JoseRMexico
Reviews.Content: We stay for 2 nights. Very nice modern hotel. Close to Plaza San Marcos and La Academia. The bathrooms bigs,new and clean. The personal very nice.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mothermaryUsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Dei Dragomanni for two nights we had two rooms # 1and 2 , though small the rooms were reasonably clean ,the sheet were clean the towels were okay ,the bathroom in room # 2 could do with a through cleaning and some face lifting,the door to this bathroom opened a a few feet from the bed and that was quite uncomfortable. My daughter who is petrified of bugs discovered a huge long legged bug in the bathroom of room no 1.My children enjoyed the TV and the breakfast in the morning I can recommend their capuccino .The location was great the hotel is a few minutes walk fron San Marco square and Doge's Palace ,Rialto Bridge is a 15/20 minutes interesting walk.The Accademia too was a short walk ,Please AVOID the Artblu Cafe in Campo De Santo Stefano we wanted to have some thing touristy but the food there was terribly disgusting the service was extremely poor.The staff at Dei Dragomanni was helpful and polite especially the lady at the desk who could speak in almost four different languages.Over all our stay at the hotel was quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Carna
Reviews.Content: The view from the private rooftop is off from the side and has a loungechair and table/chair set (see photo). Great personal service & for Venice, it's a nice size suite!

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo! Amazing city, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kel1982
Reviews.Content: As a surprise birthday present this year my boyfriend took me to Venice for the weekend. Having only found out our destination at the check in desk at the airport, I was extremely excited to say the least. I can honestly say that Venice did not disappoint. On arrival we decided to take the water bus (vaporetto) from the airport which took around 50 mins and was 13 euros each (compared to the 100 euros the water taxis charge it was great value). We hopped off the water bus at San Marco for Saint Markâ€™s Square, which is the closet stop for the Dragomanni. I would strongly recommend picking up a map of the city before you go as we would have been lost without it. Our hotel (the Dragomanni) was approximately a 10 minute walk from the San Marco stop. Everything in Venice is done on foot and I can imagine that it would be a bit of a drama for those with big heavy cases, particularly when you have to lift them up and down the steps of the countless bridges!!! I suppose thatâ€™s the best excuse to pack light. The Dragomanni is situated down a beautiful narrow street just a stonesâ€™ throw from the Grand Canal. On arrival we were greeted with a warm welcome by the hotel staff who checked us in and gave us a brief overview of the local area. They also made a reservation at a local restaurant for us â€œLa Felucaâ€� which was very popular with the locals, which is always a good sign. The staff were very helpful and could not do enough to help us. The hotel is very contemporary but manages to maintain some wonderful traditional features such as the beautiful arched stone staircases throughout. Our room was lovely and very roomy for a boutique hotel. The dÃ©cor was very elegant and the room was spotless. The bathroom was particularly large and once again very stylish with marble tiles and speakers in the shower. The breakfast was lovely and consisted of pastries, cereal, fruit, ham, cheese, breads etc etc and was served in one of the many beautiful rooms in the hotel. The hotel is ideally located for exploring the city and was a perfect base for visiting Venice. I would highly recommend the â€œVenice in a day tourâ€� as it gives you such a good insight into this beautiful city. My boyfriend booked the tour through Expedia and it included a two hour walk around the city with a very good guide and then an hour on a boat cruising the Grand Canal. A definite must for getting some lovely photos. The scenery is breathtaking, particularly from the top of the Campanile di San Marco, where you can see the whole of Venice. The Basilica is also a must and of course a trip to Venice wouldnâ€™t be complete without a gondola ride. They are extremely expensive at around 100 euros for 45 mins but totally worth it. The experience is fantastic. As a final word I would definitely recommend Venice, it is such a beautiful city and I can highly recommend the Hotel Dei Dragomanni, not only for its superb location but the fantastic service and beautiful dÃ©cor. My boyfriend and I will definitely return. I really should stop calling him that because Venice will always be remembered as the place he became my fiancÃ©. I couldnâ€™t think of a more perfect place to get engaged or a more beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: pointertrainer
Reviews.Content: This was one of three hotels we stayed at in Italy, and it was by far the best! Great for a romantic getaway, they offer lots of cute additional extras with the room. The staff is amazing, very friendly, very helpful, they all speak great english. They went the extra mile for us a few times. The room was absolutely beautiful! We loved the small coziness of the hotel itself, I don't think it has many rooms, but the rooms are fantastic. This is probably the best hotel I've ever stayed in. (No I do not get paid to write reviews!). Breakfast was great. The hotel is very close to a boat-bus stop. Overall every aspect was of our stay at this hotel was great. If we make it back to Venice we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice breakfast, room was only okay (but nice bathroom)”
Reviews.Author: SFtoSD
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location (easy walk to everything), nice lobby, sitting area, very nice granite bathroom, cable TV, quiet Cons: Room was cramped for 4 people (2 kids/2 adults), felt like being in an attic (not for the claustrophobic), room reached by small stairway

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Rutim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Carnival in February. It was our honeymoon trip. the water taxi dropped us at a jetty at the end of the calle and it was a hop skip to the hotel so great location wise and really quiet. Room was v. small but lovely and we had a canal view so at least it wasn't claustrophobic. Had some problems getting into Carnival costume in a room so small as my dress had a big frame under it ! yes, there was hardly room to move around the bed and v little space for luggage/hanging.. Bathroom nice but for some reason, even in Feb, smell of drains coming up through bath so we kept bathroom door closed. staff incredibly patient and friendly. breakfast not v varied but ok for the price of the room. next time we'd try locanda novecento in same calle as it looked v nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lesalle
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 night stay at the Dragomanni in Venice. The hotel is smartly decorated, clean and offers a great buffet breakfast. The staff are friendly and very helpful. It is situated close to all the tourist haunts but in a clean, quiet side street near the Grand Canal. I can't recommend this hotel enough and I will definately return there one day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2WorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a 11day-4 city Europe Trip in December 2008. We have to say that this hotel was one of the best we stayed at. Experience: Wonderful. Fabulous. The staff were friendly, helpful, and attentive. Hotel: Spacious, well-kept, and spacious. Location: Perfect, walking distance to all major sightseeing locations, close to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location with excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Exige28
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the â€œHotel Dei Dragomanniâ€� in Feb 2009 and very much enjoyed our stay. We were quite early for check-in but very warmly welcomed on arrival and shown to the bar while our room was prepared and our luggage carried up. The size of our â€˜superiorâ€™ room and the bathroom was very large for Venice and the quality/cleanliness was very high. The bathroom had a very nice marble bath and a very large shower. The room had a great blend of traditional Venice while also having clean modern feel to it (flat panel TV etc). The only slight downside was that the view from the windows was down into an alley, although if you leaned out the window you could see the Grand Canal. The breakfast was included and although quite simple it was tasty. Certainly enough to start you off for a day walking around Venice. The location is less than a 5 minute walk to St. Markâ€™s Square and easily accessible. I would highly recommend this hotel to couples looking for a quiet and romantic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Richard1980
Reviews.Content: A classic venetian hotel in the perfect location! The staff, room, location and breakfast were great. A big thumbs up!! Don't be put off visiting in November (high water etc), we had great weather (Cold but sunny), no high water and no huge crowds to contend with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: Ben046
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dei Dragomanni is a lovely boutique hotel situated about 10 minutes walk from St Marks Square and the Rialto bridge and is close to both the shops and the Academie vaporetti stop. The hotel staff, in particular David, were really welcoming and David gave us some excellent recommendations on where to eat. The bedrooms are of a good standard and size and are nicely decorated. We took our two children with us and they were made to feel very welcome. This is a first class choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Team_Kirby_Howse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Dragomanni for my 30th birthday treat- and what an unforgettable week it was. The boutique hotel is situated down a tiny side street off one of the million â€˜campoâ€™ in Venice, which leads out to its own jetty - the perfect setting for a romantic getaway. The hotel is stunning and the staff in the main, are welcoming and friendly. Our room (9) had a luxurious 4 poster and a stunning bathroom â€“ although all those mirrors are enough to give anyone a body complex! We were lucky to have a bit of a grand canal view and overlooked a quiet courtyard. It was lovely to wake up to the tolling of various church bells and the chug of the vaporetti. Breakfast was a quiet affair, offering a selection of contenental treats â€“ pastries, fruit, dodgy cereal and mystery meat and cheese, which filled us up for our long days of sight seeing. Dragomanni is in a fab location - the nearst Vaporetti is 2 mins away and its only about 5 mins from San Marco Piazza and Accademia bridge. Rialto is about 10-15 minutes walk. I have 2 bits of advice for Dragomanni guests: Firstly, we got eaten alive by mosquitos so you may want repellent if you leave the window open at night, and secondly, if you can afford it, iâ€™d strongly recommend getting the direct water bus (alilaguna ora) from the airport. Its 25 euro p.p but the 12 euro route takes a lifetime to get to San Marco and you wont see anything special â€“ we got the direct trip back and it was worth every extra penny. Overall we loved Venice and the hotel, and would return in a a heartbeat. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GR1NZ
Reviews.Content: Preface this review with the statement that hotels in Venice are expensive and rooms small. This recently opened (18 Months) hotel is superbly designed and decorated. We had a standard room which was nicely appointed with a view of the Peggy Guggenheim and a SMALL terrace. The room was small but the layout worked well although space for suitcases (2) was restricted!! THe hotel is not as spacious as the website pics suggest but it is a small boutique style hotel and with a Breakfast restaurant, bar, and reading room it is well appointed. The staff are very friendly and helpful!. THe location is excellent with easy acess by Motoscafi and only a 10 -12 minute walk to St Marks Square. The breakfast is of an excellent standard (European Continental) and the variety changes each day The suites look to be excellent options but at a much higher price point Highly Recommended

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: CWiebe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days in venice and loved every minute of it, including our stay at the Dei Dragomanni. We had been to Venice 2 years prior and stayed at the Liassidi Palace which we enjoyed very much. We decided to try another place this time to get a comparison . The staff here were extremely friendly and accommodating. They gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants and a boat cruise up to Stra ( near Padua) Our room ( #9 I believe ) was lovely - not very large but bright and clean. We could look out the double french windows onto a lovely garden and the Grand Canal beyond. The bathroom was a bit small with limited counter space but there was a large shelf under the sink to store toiletries. It was clean and well lit. The furnishings in the hotel were very luxurious yet comfortable. The general manager, concierge and front desk staff were so helpful with all our inquiries. We enjoyed the breakfasts and found they had the best cappuccino of all our hotels . the only difficulty we have now is deciding which of these two great hotels we like best!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Argonot
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. Our bedroom was nothing like the rooms shown on the website, being very small and very dark. The bedside light did not work as we were shown the room, staff seemed disinclined to bother about it. Bathroom was a 'wet room' so after a shower the whole floor was a pool of water. In the bedroom there was no dressing table, a very limited amount of drawer space, and - a more serious omission - no wardrobe, just a rail high up at the foot of our bed so that we could lie in bed and admire our clothes hanging up in front of us. There were two large holes in the plaster wall of the bathroom when we arrived. It looked as if a disgruntled guest had punched a hole in the wall in frustration, and I could understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Krafix
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 3 nights in Venice. We thought a slightly upscale hotel would maximize our stay. We were totally right. Althought quite more expensive that what you can find, it was such a relief to come back to this great place after a day of walking and visiting. And often, a quick stop by for a short nap and refreshing before dinner was easy and useful. Friendly and helpful service, nice breakfast (for longer stay, might have been repetitive), superb room, quiet on a small street. One of the luxury we offered ourselves is to arrive by taxi-boat from the train station instead of bus-boat (vaporetto) for the arrival. WOW! The hotel is just a few steps from Grand Canal, with someone waiting for us on the small pier to pick our luggage. Don't know how they manage to be aware but this was a wonderful start! 50euros is not cheap but hey, you're on vacation and the bus stop is quite further away! We were absolutely delighted. (we took the bus-boat to go back since we left by plane this time to Paris). So, if you're willing or want to pay more and be sure of your choice, we definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Oh, this is so nice.”
Reviews.Author: lordponts
Reviews.Content: Small, but beautifully formed. Tucked away just off the Grand Canal, you could easily miss it, it's so discrete! Our advice is to use a water taxi to come in - apart from the fact that it's a great ride, it drops you within about 30 yards of the door, and I'm not sure we would have found it in the dark from the nearest Alilaguna stop, Staff are all brilliant, pleasant and so very helpful. Our sincere thanks to them all. Our room was a delight, comfy bed and a slick bathroom. This trip was a retirement present from my Company. We will both remember it with huge pleasure and hope to be able to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jhammett17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing!!! Very clean!! This was definitely the best hotel my husband and I stayed in during our 2 week trip to Europe. It was so classy, and well put together!! The bathrooms were all marble. They did a very good job with the renovation, considering how old the building is. It is right off the Grand Canal. It was convenient to have a water taxi come straight there instead lugging around your luggage all over Venice. It's about 100 euros to get to the airport, which is about 40 mins away. I loved every part of the hotel. it was so quaint and romantic, not to mention perfect location. Venice was by far my favorite place to visit, during our trip!! It's just breathtaking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tballer9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best I stayed in on my recent trip to Italy. Great hotel and great staff. The hotel was very clean and looked to be newly remodeled. The room was about average size for a European hotel and the bathroom was relatively small, but had a nice sized shower. It was very clean. Our room overlooked an alley and if you leaned out you could see the Grand Canal. Getting there was pretty easy from the Giglio vaporetto stop, although there is one spot that was slightly confusing where you had to choose between two bridges (take the one on the right). After the second bridge on your way to the hotel, there is a small pizzeria that serves pizza by the slice--it is superb! We were at most a 10 minute walk to S. Marco Square and most other sites, so the hotel was in a good area. It also was in an area that was a little bit quieter than the other areas of Venice, which we thought was nice. The staff was top notch. They were very friendly and very helpful. We had a minor problem with our safe. It seems that the safe is battery powered and our safe gave us a low battery alert, but I did not realize what it meant. All of our travel documents were stuck inside. We realized it at about 11:00 pm the night before we were catching an early train. The night staff could not help, but first thing in the morning a woman was helping us. They never had this problem before, but it turns out we needed a 9 volt battery and they aren't easy to find in Venice. Nevertheless, they ran around and got one and we got our documents. Don't worry, because if this happens to you, I can be sure that they have a stock of 9-volt batteries on hand now. Although we missed the early train, the staff really went out of there way to make try and help us. The breakfast was very good with fresh meat and fruits and very good coffee. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Venice. You can't beat the quality for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated?”
Reviews.Author: shin747
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the reviewers that the hotel itself is quite nice and the staffs are very helpful. But I do think that it is slightly overrated on this site. I stayed during Venice Biennale 2007, but could probably have found a better deal at the same price. Our room on top floor(paid more for a view) was small, but luxuriously decorated and clean- no problem here; however, our view was a little disappointing as the hotel itself faces out to the less dramatic portion of the grand canal(for Venitian standard), and because our room was connected at the patio with our neighbors who stayed out on theirs all day, we weren't able to open the curtains without being conscious of them. So that was a drag. I probably wouldn't recommend it to my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltimeLondon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four days in Venice and can't say enough good things about the Dragomanni. Reception staff was extremely helpful, assisting with directions, reservations and anything else to make our stay more comfortable. And the bartender Michael was wonderful as well. Take the water taxi and you are literally 20 steps away from the hotel without having to carry your luggage over bridges and through crowds. San Marco Square is a short 8 min walk (crossing 4 bridges) and the Academia and Rialto bridges are short walks away also. Rooms are spotless, bathroom was quite spacious and had a shower, bathtub, toilet and bidet. Bed linens were crisp, clean cotton and Sky in the room was a plus as there was an important football match on that couldn't be missed. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to my best friend.

Reviews.Title: “Family visit to the Dragomanni.”
Reviews.Author: Diana42minneapolis
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 12 day visit in Italy. We are a family of four with two teenagers. We were so delighted with our stay in Venice at the Dragonmanni. We had a twin room, for the kids and upgraded our room for one with a view for only 30.00 dollars more a night. The rooms were very nice compact yet they felt luxurious. We were in room 25 very cute room with windows and a small little patio that over looked the Grand Canal. Our water taxi dropped us of just steps to the hotel. The bar was nice great service, the breakfast was avarage in a very small room. David and Marco were very happy to help us with whatever we needed. We thought the location was great, very accessiable. The Hotel was new but still felt classical. I would recommend this Hotel to my best friend. Diane in Minneapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: Emilyha
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a modern, clean, peaceful retreat from the maddening crowds. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of the many tourist attractions. We walked to and from the hotel every day with no problems. Based on other reviews we must have had one of the smaller rooms - our bathroom was tiny (but perfectly decorated, modern and extremely clean) and the room itself was small and overlooked a quiet alleyway which, with the busy waterways, is not such a bad thing. The room had a shower, hairdyer and personalised toiletries, the bedding was clean and white and the room had Sky TV. Our curtains were closed of an evening and chocolate sweets were left for us for Easter. For 3 nights it was expensive but, considering it was Easter, reasonable for a 4 star. Breakfast, which was included, was fresh and had a good choice of pastries, bread, cereals and juice. Taxi's can be taken from right outside the hotel (if you can afford it!) but we found it much better to walk everywhere - as advised in all the guide books. Although there are a number of restaurants and bars close by there is a lovely bar in the hotel which again is small, but well stocked. It's very relaxed, it serves snacks at any time and we found it extremely convenient when arriving back from an evening or afternoon out. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chtddrzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been newly remodeled/refurbished and it looks great. Modern conservation features were a real plus (other hotels should copy what has been done here). After seeing our room, which was beautiful but small, my husband and I upgraded to a small suite on the top floor. The extra euros were well worth it. Lots of room with great views of Venice, with skylights to add to the view. The location was ideal. A short walk to the Vaporetto and Academia Bridge, restaurants and shopping nearby. This hotel is located off a a square, down a street that ends at the Grand Canal. So despite the crowds in Venice (even in the off season), the hotel is peaceful and quiet. The staff was very helpful, making reservations and getting us tickets. A very nice continental breakfast is served. Overall, a great choice of hotel. We would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muz22
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was nice but you are paying for the location. Room was nicely done out and huge bed, mini bar wasnt really a mini-bar at all, just had a couple of bottles of water in it. Breakfast wasnt up to much, you wont be disappointed if you sleep in and miss it. Apart from that the staff were so polite and friendly and very helpful when we needed advise with something. I would recommend it but dont expect anything amazing, i would probably say more of a 3 star than 4.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MadameO56
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! Great location just enough out of the way to be quiet and exclusive. I slept with my window wide open (you gotta love Venice!). Rooms can be on the small side but very comfortable and well appointed. Lovely, unobtrusive staff. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not to expectation”
Reviews.Author: LondonCiccia
Reviews.Content: After having read the reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor, I had high expectations. I booked my "Deluxe" room directly thorugh the hotel website as the pictures of this room looked amazing. When we got there they showed us our "Deluxe" room which was absolutely nothing like the pictures on their site, much smaller, no view and dirty marks all over the walls. When I complained about this and said that I booked this hotel because of the pictures on their website (even the standard room looked better than this one!) they came up with some lame excuse that everyone's tastes are different and they had no idea what pictures I was referring to!?! I'm not even sure they showed me a deluxe room. Tehy then showed me 2 more rooms that were slightly better and we went for one of those. Still nothing compared to what I was expecting though and not worth the huge amount of money we spent on it. Again it had dirty marks (from previous guests I assume) all over the walls (a lick of paint really would not have taken much effort), the toiletries in the bathroom were the bare mimimum and only replaced once in 4 nights of staying, the mini bar consisted of 2 bottles of water and 2 lemonade (no snacks?!), the WIFI Internet was not free but quite expensive, the hotel info on the desk was a photocopy of the original document, there were no bathrobes or slippers (there have been in any othet 4 star hotel I've been to) and we only got the turn down evening service once! The breakfast was another thing absolutely not worthy of the 4 stars. The juices tasted cheap from a carton, the fruit salad was from a tin, the scrambled eggs and bacon looked so disgusting we did not even want to try it, and the overall joice of food was just very limited. Overall I would not book this hotel again, simply because I think it's more a 3 star and they take advantage of being close to Piazza San Marco so think they can get away with not giving you any of the extra little things other 4 star hotels give you. For such a huge price I expect much much more and I'm just going on experience of other hotels I've stayed at. Next time I will be going back to San Clemente hotel, further but so much better and cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ShanaLyns
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers have mentioned, DD is a lovely and recently refurbished hotel in Venice. My husband and I spent 3 nights there recently as part of our honeymoon and enjoyed it. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the location (near St. Mark's and the Peggy Guggenheim Museum) is excellent. We were also appreciative of the wide variety of English language TV channels and Wi-Fi for keeping in touch with home. Definitely give DD a shot when you're in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super service”
Reviews.Author: NotInTheOC
Reviews.Content: Great location, super friendly staff, excellent breakast. 10 minute walk to San Marco and a few minutes to the Accademia water bus stop. Front desk staff were super helpful and made some great recommendations for restaurants and tours. Internet was a ilttle hit and miss (more miss than hit actually). Overall a nice stay and I'd recommend the Dragomanni if you're in venice.
